fields.summary: Instances stuck in shutting-down state in vmware
fields.environment:
2x CLC/WS
2x CC00/SC00/UFS
2x CC01/SC01/VB/UFS
2x NC00
2x NC01

Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.1049.20140522gitaf05f4a6.el6

comments.body: I think the EUCA-9496 better describes underling issue.
There is good reason to believe that this condition is resolved by the fix to EUCA-9496.

After an extended period of churn testing (3-6 days) with ebs backed instances (using EQ for storage BE) the tests began failing due to instances stuck in shutting down state building up on the system. There's one obvious cause of failures with one esx host (10.111.5.60 below), but the stuck instances below are spread across multiple 'nodes' so not sure if this the root cause, or maybe a separate issue.  Looking at the broker logs now...
Thanks, 
-M

esx scsi issue?
I noticed a high frequency of errors on the EQ which looks like this specific ESX host is/was trying to connect/poll a target that no longer exists. The same ESX host is now pretty locked up, I can shell into the machine but can't do much (I/O errors trying to read items in /var/log, etc.). I managed to get some output from dmesg which is showing scsi errors (below).  
Maybe we deleted the target volume/lun in some order or timing which the ESX host is having trouble dealing with?

{instances stuck in shutting down for several days...

{code}
